title: City Registration
description:
ğŸ“ Everyone in Germany must register their address within 2 weeks of moving in. This is required by law and you'll need the registration document for:

â€¢ Opening a bank account
â€¢ Getting a residence permit
â€¢ Starting a job

Book an appointment:
https://www.wuerzburg.de/rathaus/buergerbuero/terminvereinbarung.

Bring your passport and rental contract! ğŸ

https://www.wuerzburg.de/r_409094
â€¢ Current enrollment certificate

â€¢ Blocked account with minimum â‚¬5,952 (better â‚¬11,904 for longer permit)
â€¢ Biometric photo (â‚¬7, take at service point)

â€¢ Application Fee: â‚¬100

ğŸ’° Important financial notes:

â€¢ Work contracts not accepted as financial proof

â° Important:

title: Visiting a Doctor
description:
ğŸ‘¨â€âš•ï¸ In Germany, you should register with a family doctor (Hausarzt) as they:

â€¢ Are your first point of contact when sick
â€¢ Can refer you to specialists
â€¢ Know your medical history
â€¢ Handle regular check-ups

Find family doctors in WÃ¼rzburg here:
https://www.medpertise.de/aerzte/allgemeinarzt-hausarzt/wuerzburg/

For emergencies, call 112 for an ambulance. ğŸš‘

title: Deutschland Ticket
description:
ğŸ« Regular price: 58â‚¬ monthly, but students get a discount through the WVV app:

https://apps.apple.com/de/app/wvvmobil/id6462117058

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mdv.wvvgullivr&hl=de

âœˆï¸ Travel anywhere in Germany with public transport! Plus, you can also travel to select cities in:

â€¢ Austria (Salzburg)
â€¢ Denmark (TÃ¸nder)
â€¢ France (Strasbourg)
â€¢ Luxembourg (Luxembourg)

âš ï¸ Important notes:

â€¢ Valid only for 2nd class regular trains
â€¢ Automatically renews each month
â€¢ Cancel before the 10th to avoid next month's charge
â€¢ Buying after the 10th commits you to 2 months

title: Radio and TV Tax (Rundfunkbeitrag)
description:
ğŸ“º The Rundfunkbeitrag is mandatory in Germany:

â€¢ Cost: â‚¬18.36 monthly
â€¢ One payment per apartment (not per person)
â€¢ Register at: www.rundfunkbeitrag.de

ğŸ’¡ Tips:
â€¢ Share the cost with roommates
â€¢ Payment options: quarterly, or yearly
â€¢ Keep proof of payment

âš ï¸ Don't ignore letters from ARD ZDF Deutschlandradio - fines can be expensive!

title: Important Daily Life Info
description:
âš ï¸ Essential things to know in Germany:

ğŸª Shopping Hours:
â€¢ Most stores close at 20:00 (8 PM)
â€¢ Closed on Sundays and public holidays
â€¢ Plan grocery shopping accordingly
â€¢ Some gas stations and small shops at train stations remain open
â€¢ Bring your own shopping bags or you'll need to buy them

ğŸŒ Internet Usage:
â€¢ Never use torrent services
â€¢ Fines for illegal downloads can be thousands of euros
â€¢ Use official streaming services only

ğŸš‚ Public Transport:
â€¢ Trains can face delays
â€¢ Download Deutsche Bahn app for real-time updates
â€¢ Always plan extra time for important appointments
â€¢ Sign up for delay alerts

ğŸ“… Public Holidays:
â€¢ Check local holiday calendar
â€¢ Stores and offices are closed
â€¢ Public transport runs on holiday schedule

ğŸ›ï¸ Studentenwerk:
â€¢ Mensa: a net of cantines with very reasonable prices for students
â€¢ Application for dorms
â€¢ Cultural events
â€¢ Infopoint and help for newcomers

https://www.swerk-wue.de/en/wuerzburg

title: New Student Checklist
description:
âœ… Essential steps when arriving in Germany as a student:

0ï¸âƒ£ Before Arrival:
â€¢ Make sure you have all the documents for enrollment and arrival
â€¢ Find an insurance company and sign a contract with them
â€¢ If you want to live in a student dorm, apply as soon as possible
â€¢ Be aware of fraud when applying for WGs and private apartments

1ï¸âƒ£ First Week:
â€¢ Register your address (Anmeldung) within 2 weeks
â€¢ Contact your health insurance company to confirm arrival and complete activation
â€¢ Open a German bank account
â€¢ Get a SIM card for your phone

2ï¸âƒ£ First Month:
â€¢ Apply for residence permit (if non-EU and visa expires in 3 months)
â€¢ Get student ID
â€¢ Register for Germany TV tax (Rundfunkbeitrag)

3ï¸âƒ£ Getting Started:
â€¢ Find accommodation
â€¢ Register with a family doctor (Hausarzt)
â€¢ Consider Deutschland Ticket for nationwide travel

4ï¸âƒ£ Integration:
â€¢ Join orientation events at university
â€¢ Register for German language courses
â€¢ Get to know the city transport system
â€¢ Join university sports or clubs

ğŸ’¡ Pro Tips:
â€¢ Keep copies of all important documents
â€¢ Save emergency numbers (112 for emergencies, 116117 for medical)
â€¢ Learn about waste separation rules
â€¢ Download essential apps (public transport, banking)
â€¢ Join student groups on social media

âš ï¸ Remember:
â€¢ Always carry student card (it's your transportation ticket)
â€¢ Keep residence permit appointments
â€¢ Check email regularly for university communications
â€¢ Plan finances carefully

More detailed information available in other sections!
